name: VALLEY BANK AND TRUST COMPANY v. David L. HERNDON and Gilda F. Herndon, his wife, Appellants, Duane B. Dillard, Realtor, Raymond Z. Hussack, Sheriff
name_abbreviation: Valley Bank & Trust Co. v. Herndon

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
parties: VALLEY BANK AND TRUST COMPANY v. David L. HERNDON and Gilda F. Herndon, his wife, Appellants, Duane B. Dillard, Realtor, Raymond Z. Hussack, Sheriff.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Mary B. Seiverling, James G. Morgan, Jr., Harrisburg, for appellants.
Robert C. Shollaert, for Appellee Valley Bank & Trust Co.
Thomas J. Finucane, Chambersburg, for Duane B. Dillard.
Patrick J. Redding, Chambersburg, for Raymond Z. Hussack.
casebody.head_matter:
526 A.2d 777
VALLEY BANK AND TRUST COMPANY v. David L. HERNDON and Gilda F. Herndon, his wife, Appellants, Duane B. Dillard, Realtor, Raymond Z. Hussack, Sheriff.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued May 14, 1987.
Decided June 1, 1987.
Reargument Denied Aug. 25, 1987.
Mary B. Seiverling, James G. Morgan, Jr., Harrisburg, for appellants.
Robert C. Shollaert, for Appellee Valley Bank & Trust Co.
Thomas J. Finucane, Chambersburg, for Duane B. Dillard.
Patrick J. Redding, Chambersburg, for Raymond Z. Hussack.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
